content.description: Start matched under the roof on a flat crimp. Move out to the ledge, and work obvious holds up and right to a slopey crux. Move left to a crimp, and top out over a bomber ledge.
content.location:
It is just right of

Numero Uno

on the Secluded Wall.

content.description:
Same start as

Oh, Serena

but stay true to the shallow dihedral (don't slap around the left arete). Small feet and a technical, higher, crux lead you to a casual topout.
content.location: This ascends the right arete on the Secluded Wall.

content.description: Start matched on the left-facing dihedral on the far right of the slab right of the arete. The gradually rising slab to the right is off (c'mon meow, we didn't want to GIVE you the start), so find more difficult feet to the left. Make a move left to a small crimp, figure yourself out, and make a move to gain the good crimp just below the slight bulge. Go straight up the face to topout, or if you're scared, use the seam out left. Do the former for full effect and fun factor. This would get more star quality if it weren't for the bastard slab out right.
content.location: This ascends the slabby wall right of the arete on the Secluded Wall.

content.description: Start on the pebbly slopers on the right side of the arete (or the undercling if you care to; doesn't really add anything). Figure out your feet and make a big move to the obvious rail above and slightly to the right. Find some feet and find crimps and arete slaps until you can gain the bomber sidepull up high. Top out.
content.location: This is the right arete on the Secluded Wall.

content.description: Start on low rail system, work your way up to two knobs, and dyno to the ledge. This has a slabby topout.
content.protection: A pad or two and a spotter.
content.location: It is the leftmost route on the Secluded Wall, just right of the tree.

content.description: Start on the big underling under the right arete. Paste the feet up, and make a move to the obvious slopey rail over the bulge. Crimps and rails lead you to heaven. This is more fun if you avoid the crack to the right.
content.location: Under the small roof of the right arete on the Secluded Wall.

content.description:
Ten feet right of

Western Mickersham

lies a crimp at about chest height. Start matched with weird feet and make a move to the obvious, positive crimp up right. Rails and crimps guide your way to the top.
content.location:
This is ten feet right of

Western Mickersham

on the Secluded Wall.

content.description:
Use the same start as

Western Mickersham

, but when you reach the sloper rail crux, continue right and up to a two finger thing'er, then reach for the ledge. Continue to the topout.
content.location:
On Secluded Wall, this tops out three feet right of

Western Mickersham

.
